issue.title: [fund.ts.v3] LFTSv3 awkward wording in propagate_const requirements

discussion.p: In the LFTSv3 prospective-working-paper N4758, [propagate_const.class_type_requirements] uses a strange turn of phrase:

blockquote.p: "In this sub-clause, t denotes a non-const lvlaue of type T, ct is a const T& bound to t, […]"

discussion.p: The last bit is strange: "ct is a const T& bound to t" is not how we usually say things. The specification-variables usually denote values, and values can't be references. Perhaps we could just say, "ct is as_const(t)"?

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4758.

blockquote.p: -1- If T is class type then it shall satisfy the following requirements. In this sub-clause t denotes a non-const lvalue of type T, ct is a const T& bound to tas_const(t), element_type denotes an object type.
